references.paper_title: How the brain keeps the eyes still
references.reason: This paper is foundational in the field of continuous attractors, introducing the concept as a mechanism for storing continuous variables in neural systems and establishing its importance in understanding biological memory.

references.fullname_first_author: D. Durstewitz, J.K. Seamans, and T.J. Sejnowski
references.reason: This review article provides a comprehensive overview of neurocomputational models of working memory, highlighting the role of continuous attractors and persistent neural activity in maintaining information over time.

references.fullname_first_author: R. Romo, C.D. Brody, A. Hernández, and L. Lemus
references.paper_title: Neuronal correlates of parametric working memory in the prefrontal cortex
references.reason: This paper presents experimental evidence supporting the existence of continuous attractors in the prefrontal cortex during the maintenance of working memory for continuous variables.

references.paper_title: Design of continuous attractor networks with monotonic tuning using a symmetry principle
references.reason: This paper provides a detailed theoretical analysis of continuous attractors, focusing on the design principles and network architectures necessary for their implementation and stability, crucial for understanding their biological plausibility.

references.fullname_first_author: A. Compte, N. Brunel, P.S. Goldman-Rakic, and X.-J. Wang
references.paper_title: Synaptic mechanisms and network dynamics underlying spatial working memory in a cortical network model
references.reason: This paper presents a detailed computational model of spatial working memory, demonstrating the role of synaptic plasticity and recurrent network dynamics in establishing and maintaining continuous attractor states.
